title: Just realized about new Warwick and Singed
body:
Their gameplay essentially counter each other even more now. Warwick is now a god of chasing people down and that's all Singed has. It's also exactly what he wants and if Warwick jumps in front of him with Q, Singed can send him right the fuck back from whence he came. 

Folks we are about to see some Wile E. Coyote and Roadrunner crap in the near future.

replies.body: Remember, chasing Singed is easy because he leaves a perfectly visible trail for you to follow!
That trail combined with Warwicks W trail will probably produce some weird colors

I bet it will taste purple!
{{champion:117}}
Colorblind people will enjoy it :D

http://i.imgur.com/DpQ9YJl.png

https://media.tenor.co/images/2086f7b62c1e64312ff0f7ae78a585b6/tenor.gif

I personally like to think that Singed Q is a neurotoxin, so he will be seeing quite strange colors.
It's not that easy to follow, to be honest: if you don't have sight of Singed the trail is invisible.
Are they ever gonna fix that?

I think it's considered skilled play of the Singed player by this point, but I agree with you.  They should make it visible (when it's not in the fog of war obviously), and just buff Singed up a bit to make up for it.  Maybe they could increase its damage or give it some new effect as compensation.
Singed the invisible poison assassin. Bringing it back to the 6 sunfire Evelyn days.

>and just buff Singed up a bit to make up for it. 

He can turn it off. (>_>)

The reason he should get a compensation buff is not that it would give away his position.

Singed's poison trail is highly telegraphed as his main damage source. Using the current situation, Singed is able to deal his damage surprisingly without the enemy noticing that early, since the poison trail is invisible. If it is always visible, that means the enemy can always escape the damage because it is so easy to avoid going in that trail.

So a small compensation because they are lowering his ability to actually deal damage less telegraphed.

> [{quoted}](name=SatomiKun,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=PEVxAKTG,comment-id=000000010000000000010000,timestamp=2017-01-21T02:24:45.181+0000)

Using the current situation, Singed is able to deal his damage surprisingly without the enemy noticing that early, since the poison trail is invisible. If it is always visible, that means the enemy can always escape the damage because it is so easy to avoid going in that trail.
> 
> So a small compensation because they are lowering his ability to actually deal damage less telegraphed.

Thing is, Singed is already rewarded in any scenario he runs into a bush, because it's a small corridor where chasing him is impossible 90% of the time. If you DON'T run into the bush, he gets away scott free, if you do, you die or have to back due to the poison damage, leaving you rather annoyed. It already does a lot of damage with just one tick. If he goes into a bush you don't know if he turned it off to conserve mana or not right now. You could say there's no CLARITY, which Riot basically said they wanted more of. Buffing Singed's poison trail because there suddenly IS clarity, is kinda silly imo. He's already super annoying to deal with even without the ridiculous bush tactics. If they DID wanna buff Singed because of adding clarity to his poison trail, they could buff his flip damage. At least that wouldn't be terribly oppressive. He doesn't need any more damage on his poison trail.

Never said they have to buff his poison damage, just explained the argument that he should get some compensation in that case.

Singed is actually kinda weird... they probably keep him the way he is because he has unique playstyle but that playstyle doesn't really feel satisfying for a Singed player imo. At least not for me, I play Singed because I like the character himself and being a mad chemist.

I wish they would just rework him, giving him some tools to actually really make plays. His passive giving you health for mana is boring and doesn't change your playstyle at all. Most of the time you just run around as Singed with poison trail toggled on.

If they could rework him to match the fantasy of an alchemist, that would be great. But I don't have much hope for that.

"Why take that away"
Well, there were people loving the old Yorick, old Fiora, old Poppy... All these champions were actually outdated and/or unhealthy and so got reworked.

Singed is not unhealthy, but outdated in my opinion. I think he could use a rework.
But I already work on a champ concept for an alchemy champion, don't worry. :P 
And it is not a Singed rework but a new champion.

old yorick was just cancer to play against and not even that good. Old poppy was so broken after triforce that she'd get nerfed to shit if she were to get popular.

reworking singed would be so useless. He's not in a bad spot
Is he outdated? i mean if you consider having simple abilities as being outdated, then yeah he is. However there's alot of "outdated" champs doing rather well then. just leave singed be already, don't try to fix what isn't broken.

You are right about Yorick and Poppy. How about Warwick?
He was not broken, simple and straightforward. Yet they reworked him to give him some tools to make plays, while keeping his identity intact.

I think the same could be done for Singed. Keeping his identity as the guy with the poison trail, but improve his kit so you are able to do a bit more.

Warwick:
AS i just happened to have played a game of WW today. honestly he needed it. He's fun and freelo in low elo, but if you take a closer look he can't do much. 

Pre 6 you can't gank most lanes except for bot, AS champs. Or if the enemy is almost diving.
Once you get some damage items (bloodrazor + botrk for me) you actually are pretty strong as long as you can aa them. But if someone has mobility they'll get away from you quite easily + you're really tanky yet so choosing to chase is risky. 

While Warwick keeps his identity as a champ that can chase you down, and they emphasized on that. And gave him the tools he needs.

They were also kinda limited with Warwick. He's the beginner jungler. For most people it's the first jungler they played, and they tried to keep that part of him. 

Singed:
Singed isn't considered one of the beginner champs as far as i know, and he's quite unique.
He has an incredibly simple kit but i remember not being able to put it to use when i first started playing him, i actually gave up on him for a while. Then i found out i'm better at lane singed than proxy singed and i've been successful ever since. 
However singed can still do what he needs to do. You just have to figure out ways to use the kit. I guess you could look at high ranked players but i don't do that srry.

His passive while not the greatest, still gives 256 bonus hp with just his base mana. It also allows him to build items that only give mana. (i mean like the pocket sivir ult, Frozen heart, etc) and still get some more hp. 
And it is what it is PASSIVE, a passive doesn't have to be a minigame. it should be a little extra that helps your kit. Warwicks current passive is like that too and they modified it. (a change i really like). But it's still pretty passive. 
Maybe they could make it give less health but also make it give him resistances/AP/tenacity (only 1 of the 3 ofc).
Also change the tooltip so dumbasses finally realise his shield actually does something, smh.

If they limit it to some QoL changes to his abilities i'd be fine with it.
flashy plays aren't his style anyway, imo.

I'll admit tho, New splash arts. Rito pls let Surfer Singed become the masterpiece it should be.
Make it so his ult causes his poison to apply a 10% slow.

that would be useless. most of the time you buy rylais. rylais gives a 20% slow, the highest slow is applied. this would mean that building rylais only gives 10% extra but it also gives you the slow at all times. all in all it would probably mean the slow on his ult is useless. imo

That's the point. They should just make his ult give him some kind of slow, either they should make it a weak one in exchange for a slight power decrease or a strong one that will make it so he isn't shackled to Rylais like he is.

If anything it should be a 25% slow actually, just strong enough that it devalues Rylais on him but weak enough that you might just get it anyway for a consistent slow. I just want him to not be so ram rodded into buying Rylais.
i'd rather just see his ult amplify slows then. this would make it so mega ahesive is affected by it, and rylai's and deadmans.

Ooooohhhh.... that's a really good idea actually. No slow itself but improves slows, it would also give him more team utility since that way him just running around through the enemy team would have a more obvious benefit for the rest of his team to see.
